commit message:
Download nodes.json as compressed file

The nodes.json file will be downloaded as a gzip compressed file.
Before compressing, the file is currently about 2.4 MB big. After
compressing it, its size is currently only about 800 KB.

Improve compatability with Android 6

On Android 6 and above the permission to access the user's location
will be requested on run time.
Replace ListView with RecycleView in NearestNodeFragment
Replace ListView with RecycleView in AddRemoveNetworksFragment

Move functions for retriving ssids to NetworkRecyclerAdapter

The functions for reading the ssids from the ssids.json file and for
checking which ssids are already included in the network configuration
were moved from AddRemoveNetworksFragment to the NetworkRecyclerAdapter.

Add support for outdated/deprecated SSIDs

The app is now capable to show the user if a SSID is outdated/deprecated.
The app checks the ssids.json for a array nemed 'deprecated', that holds
all freifunk ssids that are no longer official in use. A new option was
added so that the user can decide if outdated ssids should always be
shown. The default setting is to not always show outdated ssids. If the
app finds an outdated freifunk SSID in the network configuration, it
always shows it and sets its background color to orange. If the user
opted to always show outdated SSIDs, the background color of outdated
SSIDs will be set to yellow. The info activity was updated to inform about
the meaning of the different colors.
Fix issue with progress bar and permission request
Show info dialog if a SSID could not be removed
Keep the add/remove buttons pinned at the bottom

Show dialog if ssids could not be removed

If some ssids could not be removed with the 'Remove all' action a dialog
will inform the user.

Change when downloadSsidJsonResponseReceiver is (un)registered

Instead of registering downloadSsidJsonResponseReceiver in onResume() and
unregistering in onPause(), it will now be registered in onStart() and
unregistered in onDestroy(). This guarantees that the ssid list is updated
when the ssids.json file was updated even when the
AddRemoveNetworksFragment is paused.
Change color of a ssid only if addition or removal was actually successful

Replace app.Fragment with support.v4.app.Fragment

The Fragment implementation in the support library tends to get bug fixes
quicker. Also using the support library implementation makes it easier to
keep compatability with future android versions.
